shortDescription: Like a strat, but skinnier with a more dense wood.
descriptionHTML: Like a strat, but skinnier with a more dense wood. Monkeypod solidbody with lots of cool details in the grain. Roasted maple neck with a ribboned sapele fretboard and BG peacock symbol. SSS configuration with Fender pickups. Gotoh tremolo bridge and tuners. Neck-on switch for bonus tele-tones. Bright but warm!

shortDescription: Doppel with a zebrawood top and LP-style headstock
descriptionHTML: It's a Doppel! This one has a Kansas-grown walnut body and a zebrawood top. It's all chambered, of course. I went wild with the contours on the back and really love the look and feel. It's got two Iron Gear Surf Rider pickups in it-- basically very hot jazzmaster pickups-- and it's got that great "plunk" sound that jazzmasters make. It's got CTS pots and a traditional volume/tone setup. Fender bridge.The neck is mahogany with an ebony fretboard, with a sort of blended LP-ish headstock-- not a scarf joint, though. Bone nut, 9.5" radius neck. This one is very versatile and a looker!

shortDescription: Doppel made of spalted hackberry with tele pickups and electronics
descriptionHTML: It's a doppel! My signature series. This one features a spalted hackberry body with some slick contours and some epoxy-filled wormholes and things. It has very hot Odezza pickups and high-quality electronics set up in the traditional tele way. This one features a 25.5" scale maple neck with rosewood fretboard, including a bottom-operating trussrod (way easier to use, in my opinion). It's got a bone nut with a 9.5" radius. This one particularly has an experimental neck style, where towards the higher frets it's pretty thin, and in cowboy chord territory it's pretty thick: the idea being that it feels almost acoustic around frets 1-5. It's a cool idea for you chord lovers!

shortDescription: Swamp ash single P-90 pickup in 24.75" scale
descriptionHTML: It's a Doppel! My signature series double-cutaway-style guitar. This one is made of a swampy ash and features a hardtail Fender bridge with a single Space Llama P-90 pickup. If you're not familiar with this builder...get familiar with it! Single CTS 500k pot makes for a bright, full sound...especially for just one pickup! Neck is maple in 24.75" scale with a rosewood fretboard, bone nut, and medium size frets in 9.5" radius. Absolute rocker.

shortDescription: Molly is a mahogany/walnut guitar with Rickenbacker-style pickups and electronics
descriptionHTML: Meet Molly! Molly is a unique body: imagine a solid-body 335 meets a double-cutaway tele meets a Les Paul Junior. I can't decide on a name? Fatty (to go with my Skinny Strats?) 334 (like a smaller 335), something else?! I'll figure that out later. Anyway, she has a chambered mahogany back with a decades-old Kansas walnut top. Some contouring on front and back...she's very light! The pickups are Gemini Rickenbacker-style toaster pickups and all the guts from a 90s Rickenbacker 330 (I like the slightly higher output of this wiring versus the original)! Great, thick, bright sound that'll get you everything from "I Can't explain" to "On a Plain"! Fantastic Kluson bridge as well! For the neck, we've got a 25" scale tele-style made of mahogany with a rosewood fingerboard. Side dots but nothing but tone on the frets! 9.5" radius, Wilkinson tuning machines, and bone nut! It won't be just your bird who can sing with this guitar!

shortDescription: Bertha is a two-piece tele with G&L ASAT pickups
descriptionHTML: Meet Bertha! Bertha is a soft maple back/ curly makora top telecaster. She‚Äôs got a pair of ceramic G&L American ASAT pups that sound so good‚Äî hotter than I expected! Cool thing about these pups, you can adjust each pole with an Allen wrench for maximum control. G&L ash tray vintage bridge,CTS pots, switchcraft jack. I think going forward this will be my ‚ÄúBlankc headstock shape‚Äù ‚Ñ¢ or something üòÆ. One fun thing with this guitar was trying to leave as much as possible a little rustic‚Äî insect holes, spalting, etc. can breathe! I built this one because I didn‚Äôt have any more teles and thought I needed one. But she‚Äôs for sale. Located at Guitarma in Lawrence, KS

shortDescription: Ruby is an ambrosia maple mustang-tele hybrid
descriptionHTML: Meet Ruby! Ruby is made of a beautiful ambrosia maple, then dyed orange for a truly stand-out kind of player! Maple neck with rosewood fretboard that features a zero fret at the nut for a smoother, more consistent sound. Ruby has an authentic, string-thru-body ashtray-style bridge with a Warp Core Pickups (from Arizona-- check them out sometime!) tele-style bridge pickup with tons of great punch and a Q Pickups (all the way from Croatia!) mustang-style neck pickup with fantastic warmth. Great high-end electronic components as well. This girl is unforgettable, just like her namesake! Located at Mr. Reid's Workshop in Independence, KS. Check out a demo here: https://youtu.be/awLIdJY0ZaY

The guitar is a stringed musical instrument that is usually fretted (with some exceptions) and typically has six or twelve strings. It is usually held flat against the player's body and played by strumming or plucking the strings with the dominant hand, while simultaneously pressing selected strings against frets with the fingers of the opposite hand. A guitar pick may also be used to strike the strings. The sound of the guitar is projected either acoustically, by means of a resonant hollow chamber on the guitar, or amplified by an electronic pickup and an amplifier.
